Now you can check your glucose as easily as you check your email.

Introducing the Guardian™ Connect continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) system. The Guardian Connect system uses a tiny sensor to measure glucose levels in fluid just below the skin. It takes readings all day and night and sends them to your phone via a small wireless transmitter, so you can see how you’re doing anytime.

With the Guardian Connect mobile app, you can see your most recent glucose data, your glucose trends over time, your sensor and your transmitter status. You can also receive alerts to notify you when you’re going above or below your preferred range and keep track of daily events which may impact your glucose levels.

Your mobile app also sends your data to CareLink™ Personal therapy management software, so you can see your full information online and share your information with family or friends. Those closest to you can even receive SMS messages whenever you go out of range!

To use the Guardian Connect system, you will need the Guardian Connect transmitter and sensor as well as this app!

* Not compatible with MiniMed pumps.

The application is based on the scientific research. It helps to determine the fertile days of the month, so you can either achieve or avoid pregnancy. The application uses the date of the last period and shows the date of the next period, the best days to conceive a baby, the ovulation day and when you can avoid pregnancy.

* Scientific Research *

The popular baby gender prediction method is used by default. But it’s based only on the widely-spread theory by Landrum Shettles. The application also supports the scientific baby gender prediction method. It’s based on the scientific research by Rodrigo Guerrero and the statistics of thousands of women.

You can change the gender prediction method on the “Settings” screen. But remember that either gender prediction method shows only slightly higher chances of conceiving a girl or a boy and it never guarantees the result.

* Full Version *

This is the full version of the application. You will be able to see the following data:

- The probability of getting pregnant on the current or on any selected day.
- The probability of conceiving a girl or a boy using the selected gender prediction method.
- Chances of getting pregnant during the current period.
- Chances of conceiving a girl or a boy during the current period.

* How to Use *

To generate the menstrual calendar you have to provide the following data:

- The first day of the last cycle (select the day and use the button “Add”).
- Average length of the menstrual cycle (adjust it on the “Settings” screen).
- Length of the luteal phase (most women can use the default value).

The application works best for women with regular menstrual cycle. But average cycle length is also a good way to predict when the ovulation should happen.

Por otra parte, ConsultaVet App ofrece información terapéutica únicamente sobre animales no productores de alimentos, con posibilidad de cálculo de dosis orientativas y generales en función de la especie y el peso.

La app ConsultaVet también ofrece diversas herramientas de ayuda y apoyo al veterinario en el diagnóstico y tratamiento de diversas patologías propias de la medicina veterinaria.

ConsultaVet App contiene una serie de pautas orientativas, dirigidas únicamente a los veterinarios, que pretenden facilitar su labor, pero en modo alguno sustituir su criterio técnico y científico, ya que es al profesional veterinario que está asistiendo cada proceso patológico en un animal concreto a quien corresponde, de forma exclusiva, la decisión final y la responsabilidad de la prescripción.

ConsultaVet App recoge las opiniones vertidas por veterinarios independientes, conforme a su propia experiencia, limitándose la editorial a la publicación de tales pautas o guías, sin perjuicio, como ya señalamos, de que es el veterinario encargado del tratamiento de la enfermedad del animal objeto de estudio quien debe prescribir, como único responsable del mismo, el que considere más ajustado al caso sometido a su consideración, en función de la exploración y exámenes practicados, su experiencia personal, la doctrina científica más autorizada en ese momento, los antecedentes clínicos y demás circunstancias concurrentes.

Awake intubation and emergency surgical airway/front of neck access are
advanced high-risk airway interventions.

Individual healthcare providers perform these procedures infrequently.
As a result, techniques tend to be based on experience and training.
Unfortunately, patient-based evidence remains relatively sparse.

We would like to change this.

This app does not give advice. Instead, we want to collect your clinical
experiences in an anonymous and secure manner and combine them with the
experiences of other healthcare practitioners throughout the
international airway community. More participants mean more data, and
more meaningful results.

By sharing your clinical experiences, you are contributing to data
collection done in a new way, captured using the scale necessary for
these infrequent and high-risk procedures. Information and experiences
that have been difficult to study using traditional research methods.

Together, we can begin to build an understanding and to identify what
works, what doesn’t, what may be causing harm, and why. Results can be
tracked on www.airwaycollaboration.org.

When a family member or a friend has diabetes, you want to be supportive and stay close.  You might want to know if their glucose levels go too high or too low, be able to quickly and easily access their insulin pump and Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) system information. 
 
With the CareLink™ Connect app, now you can remotely see their glucose levels and insulin pump information wherever you are, so you can know how they are doing.

The CareLink™ Connect app helps you quickly accomplish these tasks: 
Let you securely view glucose levels, graphs, and trends
Sends you high or low glucose levels notifications, so you can be informed and supportive
Shows you the status of the insulin pump system, for greater peace of mind

To remotely view pump system information, family members or friends need to install the CareLink™ Connect app on their compatible mobile device. Also, the person with diabetes needs a MiniMed™ 700-series insulin pump, the MiniMed™ Mobile app installed on a compatible mobile device, which then should be connected online to the CareLink™ software. To find a list of compatible devices, please visit your local Medtronic website. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: In order to receive real-time updates, the app needs to continuously receive data from the CareLink™ servers, and the insulin pump system needs to sync with the CareLink™ servers through the MiniMed™ Mobile app. The CareLink™ Connect app only works with the MiniMed™ 700-series insulin pump systems; it currently does not support other standalone CGM systems, MiniMed™ or Paradigm™ insulin pumps. 

The CareLink™ Connect app is intended to provide a secondary display of insulin pump and CGM (Continuous Glucose Monitoring) system data on a supported mobile device. CareLink™ Connect app is not intended to replace the real-time display of insulin pump or CGM data on the primary display device. All therapy decisions should be based on the primary display device.

CareLink™ Connect app is not intended to analyze or modify the insulin pump and CGM data that it receives. Nor is it intended to control any function of the insulin pump or CGM system to which it is connected. CareLink™ Connect app is not intended to receive information directly from the insulin pump or CGM system.

DosisPedia ayuda en el día a día a más de 600.000 profesionales resolviendo más de 32 millones de consultas.

1º SELECCIONA EL GRUPO DE FÁRMACOS
DosisPedia es una guía farmacológica que permite al médico consultar rápidamente el fármaco y definir la prescripción. Para comenzar elige el grupo de fármacos del que deseas obtener información.

2º SELECCIONA EL FÁRMACO
Puedes seleccionar uno de los medicamentos y también puedes escribir el nombre del fármaco o del principio activo en el buscador.

3º CONSULTA LA INDICACIÓN PARA CADA PESO
DosisPedia incluye un sistema que calcula automáticamente la dosis a administrar al paciente en función del peso.
Pulsa la ficha del fármaco que quieras consultar y aparecerá la barra de pesos. Mueve la barra y busca el peso de tu paciente. DosisPedia te sugiere la dosis para ese peso. Además podrás consultar las indicaciones generales del fármaco: vía de administración, posología y presentación.

CARACTERÍSTICAS
- Sección Emergencias: Dosis calculadas según el peso del niño para procesos de urgencia vital, patologías urgentes y emergencias sanitarias pediátricas.

- Buscador de medicamentos: Un buscador avanzado permite encontrar medicamentos en tiempo real a partir del nombre del fármaco o del principio activo.
- Calculadora de dosis por peso: Un selector permite ajustar el peso del paciente para consultar dinámicamente las indicaciones y la dosis adecuada a suministrar.
- Avisos y comentarios: Las fichas de los medicamentos incluyen advertencias, precauciones, contraindicaciones, interacciones medicamentosas y posibles reacciones adversas.
- Medicamentos actualizados: Actualizaciones periódicas de fármacos en la app. Inclusión de nuevos fármacos, ampliación de especificaciones de dosis.

DOSISPEDIA, APP MÉDICA DE REFERENCIA.
DosisPedia es una aplicación médica de dosificación pediátrica para la ayuda en consulta y urgencias. Esta farmacopea es el vademécum gratis en español de referencia médica y farmacológica para especialistas que atienden niños; se posiciona desde el año 2016 en el Top 10 de la categoría Medicina en el App Store, en España y en varios países de América Latina como México, Colombia, Perú, Argentina o Venezuela.

Emergencias, Alergia - Antihistamínicos, Analgésicos - Antitérmicos - Aines, Antiepilépticos, Antiinfecciosos, Asma - Respiratorio, Cardiología, Corticoides sistémicos, Dermatología, Endocrino - Urgencias metabólicas, Gastroenterología, Hematología, Intoxicaciones - Antídotos, Nefro Urología, Neurología - Psiquiatría, Oftalmología, ORL, Reumatología, Vitaminas y minerales.
